en.purpose: This is used for assessing the risk level in patients with confirmed pleural infection.
en.use:
The RAPID Score is based on five attributes. Each attribute is graded from 0 to 2. The total score is obtained by adding up the points of all five attributes.

 Attributes                                       0                                                    1                                                        2

Serum urea                <5mmol/l or <14mg/dl           5-8 mmol/l or 14-23 mg/dl             >8 mmol/l or > 23 mg/dl

Age                                       < 50 yrs                                              50-70 yrs                                             > 70 yrs

Purulence                                Yes                                                    No                      

Infection source         Community acquired                    Hospital acquired

Serum albumin                    >= 27 g/l                                             < 27 g/l

The following assessments are made;

Risk level assessments:

Total score 0 - 2 - Low risk

                    3 - 4 - Medium risk

                    5 - 7 - High Risk

3-month mortality (%)

Total Score 0 - 2 - 1.5%

                    3 - 4 - 17.8%

                    5 - 7 - 47.8%
en.misuse: Shall not be used in cases where bacterial pleural infection is not confirmed.

other_details.references:
1.      A Clinical Score (RAPID) to Identify Those at Risk for Poor Outcome at Presentation in Patients With Pleural Infection. Chest. 2014 Apr 1;145(4):848–55.

2.      White HD, Henry C, Stock EM, Arroliga AC, Ghamande S. Predicting Long-Term Outcomes in Pleural Infections. RAPID Score for Risk Stratification. Annals ATS. 2015 Jul 20;12(9):1310–6.

gt0001.description: The RAPID Score is used to assess the risk levels in the patients with pleural infection. It is based on five attributes, namely, Serum Urea, Age, Purulence of the pleuritic fluid, Infection source and Serum albumin. Each attribute is given points from 0 to 2. This is one of the useful factor in determining the treatment regime in such cases.

gt0003.description: The serum urea level obtained are graded into three levels from 0 to 2

gt0004.description: The age of the patient is recorded and the points are given accordingly.

gt0005.description: Observes if the pleral fluid is purulent or not.

gt0006.description: Observation of the source of the infection, if it is community acquired or hospital acquired

gt0007.description: The serum albumin level obtained are graded into three levels from 0 to 2

gt0009.description: Sum of the score of all attributes in the list

gt0011.description: Assessment of Rapid score to determine the risk level for pleural infection patients.

gt0012.description: Predicts the 3 month mortality (%) in patients with pleural infection.
